intro: Himantoglossum hircinum var. hircinum, commonly known as the alpine buttercup, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to the alpine regions of Europe. It belongs to the family Ranunculaceae and is characterized by its bright yellow, cup-shaped flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or grassy habitats at high altitudes, where it thrives in cool, moist conditions. Its leaves are palmately divided, and the plant is known for its ornamental value in alpine gardens. Due to its specific habitat requirements, it is considered a rare and protected species in many areas.
